title: Behavioral Interview Rubric

dimensions.name: communication
dimensions.description: Clarity, structure, and completeness of the story.

levels.description: Disorganized story, missing context or outcome, hard to follow.
Basic structure and clarity, but gaps in context or results.
Clear, structured STAR response with good pacing and focus.
Concise, compelling narrative with strong clarity and reflection.

dimensions.name: problem_solving
dimensions.description: Problem framing, options considered, and decision making.

levels.description: Little framing; decisions unclear or arbitrary.
Explains some constraints and decisions, limited trade-offs.
Frames trade-offs and explains rationale for key decisions.
Shows strong judgment, anticipates alternatives and risks.

dimensions.name: correctness_reasoning
dimensions.description: Evidence, results, and accountability for outcomes.

levels.description: No results or unverifiable claims.
Some results or outcomes, limited evidence.
Clear outcomes with concrete impact or metrics.
Strong evidence, quantified impact, and ownership.

dimensions.name: complexity
dimensions.description: Scope, scale, and difficulty of the situation handled.

levels.description: Small scope or unclear impact.
Moderate scope with some impact.
Meaningful scope, cross-team or measurable impact.
Large scope, significant impact, sustained influence.

dimensions.name: edge_cases
dimensions.description: Handling challenges, risks, and lessons learned.

levels.description: Ignores challenges or risks.
Mentions obstacles but limited mitigation.
Addresses risks and mitigation with clear examples.
Proactively identifies risks, alternatives, and lessons.

overall_scoring: Compute the overall score as the average of the five dimension scores, scaled to 0-100 and rounded.
